decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking, Sakura-Tribe Scout, and Amulet of Vigor. This allows the player to play large threats like Primeval Titan and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath earlier than normal. The deck also utilizes lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Field of the Dead to generate additional value and win conditions. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and toolbox options, while cards like Explore and Summoner's Pact help with consistency and searching for key pieces. The deck focuses on explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and land synergies.

This deck aims to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats with Lightning Bolt, and ramping up its own mana with Growth Spiral and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The ultimate goal is to assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent's life total. Mystic Sanctuary is included to recur key spells like Cryptic Command, while Wilt and Izzet Charm provide additional utility. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through a powerful combo finish.

This deck focuses on utilizing the dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with key cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam, while also generating card advantage with Life from the Loam. The goal is to quickly bring back creatures from the graveyard and deal damage to the opponent, all while using cards like Cathartic Reunion to filter through the deck. The addition of Ox of Agonas and Silversmote Ghoul provide additional ways to keep the engine going and overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats and damage.

The primary focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total through aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early with cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Kolaghan's Command adds flexibility and card advantage to keep the pressure on. With a fast and disruptive game plan, this deck aims to finish the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruption spells such as Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Stubborn Denial and Assassin's Trophy. The inclusion of cards like Dismember and Temur Battle Rage allow for additional versatility and reach when closing out games. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also enabling the deck to consistently find the necessary lands with Traverse the Ulvenwald.

The main concept of the Gruul Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly by playing aggressive low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently by utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Tarmogoyf, and Lightning Bolt to chip away at the opponent's life total. Mishra's Bauble and Light Up the Stage help to keep the deck's hand full of threats, ensuring a steady stream of damaging plays. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining a fast and relentless pace to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's resources with cards like Pillage, Blood Moon, and Chandra, Torch of Defiance, while ramping up with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf for explosive plays. The deck also includes powerful threats like Glorybringer and Bonecrusher Giant to pressure your opponent. Klothys, God of Destiny provides graveyard hate and lifegain, while Seasoned Pyromancer generates card advantage. Bloodbraid Elf offers additional value by cascading into more spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and efficient threats in a Gruul color combination.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient threats like Monastery Swiftspear, Stormwing Entity, and Sprite Dragon, while supporting them with cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and selection with spells like Light Up the Stage and Opt, as well as burn spells like Burst Lightning to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to play aggressively and disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats and card advantage.

This Dredge combo deck focuses on filling up the graveyard quickly with cards like Life from the Loam, Creeping Chill, and Cathartic Reunion, allowing you to bring back powerful creatures like Narcomoeba, Ox of Agonas, and Golgari Thug. By dredging through your deck with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Prized Amalgam, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck also includes discard outlets like Conflagrate and Smiting Helix to further fuel your graveyard strategy. The land base is designed to support quick and consistent dredging.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm opponents with low-cost, aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage to the opponent's life total as fast as possible, utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Light Up the Stage to draw into more threats and removal. With a focus on efficiency and speed, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and end the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting opponent's mana base with cards like Magus of the Moon and Pillage, while ramping up your own mana with Utopia Sprawl. This allows you to play powerful threats like Glorybringer and Klothys, God of Destiny to dominate the board. The deck also utilizes versatile creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Scavenging Ooze, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt, to maintain board presence and control the tempo of the game. Overall, the deck focuses on disrupting opponents while building up your own board presence for victory.

This deck focuses on using ramp and control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while ramping into powerful threats like Glorybringer and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The key strategy is to use Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf to accelerate mana production, while using cards like Pillage and Blood Moon to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Klothys, God of Destiny to apply pressure and stabilize the board. Additionally, the deck has card advantage engines like Mazemind Tome and Seasoned Pyromancer to ensure consistent resources.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of low-cost, aggressive Human creatures that can quickly grow in power through synergistic effects. By utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Champion of the Parish, along with disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game. The mana base is designed to support the tribal theme of the deck, ensuring that the creatures can be cast consistently and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering and removing threats while ramping up mana with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Growth Spiral. The ultimate goal is to assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage to the opponent. This deck also utilizes land recursion with cards like Mystic Sanctuary and Wrenn and Six to gain incremental advantage and outvalue the opponent in the long game. Additionally, cards like Lightning Bolt provide necessary removal and reach to close out the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful spells such as Cryptic Command, Fact or Fiction, and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to cast big threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nexus of Fate. Additionally, it includes a variety of lands for utility and consistency, as well as a small amount of removal and burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The overall strategy revolves around out-valuing the opponent and winning through control.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells like Burst Lightning, Gut Shot, and Lightning Bolt to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. By using prowess creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Sprite Dragon, and Stormwing Entity, this deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent and close out the game before they can establish a solid defense. The deck also includes card draw options like Opt and Light Up the Stage to maintain momentum and keep up the aggression. With a low mana curve and efficient spells, this deck aims to win fast and decisively.
